dcterms:creator: T. F. Bewley
dcterms:description: A model of decision-making under Knightian uncertainty, focusing on preferences that are incomplete due to ambiguity.
dcterms:title: Bewley preferences

dcterms:creator: F. Echenique
L. Pomatto
M. Miyashita
J. Vinson
dcterms:description: A framework for twofold multiprior preferences that captures the failures of contingent reasoning in decision-making.
dcterms:title: Twofold preferences

dcterms:creator: M. Chandrasekher
M. Frick
R. Iijima
Y. Le Yaouanq
dcterms:description: A representation of ambiguity preferences through dual-self models, highlighting the conflict between optimistic and pessimistic evaluations.
dcterms:title: Dual-Self Representations of Ambiguity Preferences

dcterms:creator: I. Gilboa
F. Maccheroni
M. Marinacci
D. Schmeidler
dcterms:description: A model that integrates objective and subjective rationality in decision-making under uncertainty, focusing on multiple priors.
dcterms:title: α-maxmin expected utility

dcterms:creator: H. Crès
I. Gilboa
N. Vieille
dcterms:description: A study on the aggregation of multiple prior opinions in decision-making contexts, addressing the challenges of conflicting beliefs.
dcterms:title: Aggregation of opinions

dcterms:creator: E. Ok
P. Ortoleva
G. Riella
dcterms:description: An exploration of incomplete preferences under uncertainty, focusing on the indecisiveness in beliefs versus tastes.
dcterms:title: Incomplete Preferences Under Uncertainty

dcterms:creator: S. Cerreia-Vioglio
dcterms:description: A theoretical exploration of objective rationality and preferences that are averse to uncertainty.
dcterms:title: Objective Rationality and Uncertainty Averse Preferences

dcterms:creator: S. T. Trautmann
G. van de Kuilen
dcterms:description: An overview of ambiguity attitudes, discussing how individuals respond to uncertainty in decision-making.
dcterms:title: Ambiguity Attitudes
